RelatedSentence: The government - owned Export Credit Guarantee Corporation of India ( ECGC ) recorded creditable financial results in FY14 despite a global slowdown .

The government - owned Export Credit Guarantee Corporation of India ( ECGC ) reported profit after tax of Rs 360.69 crore for the year 2013-14 , a growth of 48.5 per cent over the corresponding period in 2012-13 .
The Board of directors has proposed a dividend of Rs 88 crore ( Rs 60 crore ) to be paid to the government for 2013-14 .

RelatedSentence: Therefore the role of ECGC , the national export credit insurer of India , continues to be very important and crucial as exporting without suitable credit insurance is fraught with huge risks , '' he said .

During FY14 , ECGC paid out 381 claims worth Rs 109.29 crore to exporters under policies issued to them and 175 claims worth Rs 639.55 crore to financing banks under Export Credit Insurance for Banks ( ECIB ) scheme .

A1: the National Export Insurance Account ( NEIA )
RelatedSentence: ECGC also manages the National Export Insurance Account ( NEIA ) Trust on behalf of the government and under this , 16 projects of value of Rs 10,132.1 crore were covered and the projects are being executed by Indian exporters in countries like Sri Lanka , Myanmar , Iraq , Algeria , Zambia and Tanzania .
